Package com.ibm.eznosql

Class Connection

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.eznosql.Connection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable
    public class Connection
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.AutoCloseable
    The Connection class represents a connection between the user's task and the database. A valid instance will contain a unique connection token which must be provided to other APIs for reading and writing to the database. Additionally, multiple connections can be established as needed by the same user task or other tasks executing across the sysplex, thus allowing for the use of different options, or to load balance the workload across different processors.

    • Method Detail

      • fromDataSetName

        public static Connection fromDataSetName​(java.lang.String dataSet)
                                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                         EzNoSQLException
        Instantiates a connection to an EzNoSQL database with a unique connection token. This method uses the following default Connection parameters: ReadAccess.READ_ONLY, ConnectionIntegrity.NO_READ_INTEGRITY, timeout = 0, and isAutoCommitEnabled = true.
        Parameters:
        dataSet - The EzNoSQL database name (e.g. String dataSetName = "MY.DATA.SET").
        Returns:
        Returns a Connection instance with a valid connection token; otherwise, returns null if unable to locate the database (i.e. data set is not in the catalog).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the data set name string parameter is invalid
        EzNoSQLException - If the call returned an error, see class for detailed usage and error handling.

      • fromDataSetName

        public static Connection fromDataSetName​(java.lang.String dataSet,
                                         java.util.EnumSet<ReadAccess> flags,
                                         ConnectionIntegrity integrity,
                                         short timeout,
                                         boolean isAutoCommitEnabled)
                                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                         EzNoSQLException
        Instantiates a connection to an EzNoSQL database with a unique connection token.
        Parameters:
        dataSet - The EzNoSQL database name (e.g. String dataSetName = "MY.DATA.SET").
        flags - The flags parameter indicates read, write, and/or sequential access. See ReadAccess for usage.
        integrity - The integrity parameter indicates whether shared locks are obtained for document retrieval and the duration the lock will be held. See ConnectionIntegrity for usage.
        timeout - The timeout parameter specifies the duration a lock request will wait (in seconds) before terminating.
        isAutoCommitEnabled - The autocommit parameter specifies automatic commits after a transaction in a recoverable database. This parameter is ignored in non-recoverable databases.
        Returns:
        Returns a Connection instance with a valid connection token; otherwise, returns null if unable to locate the database (i.e. dataset not in catalog).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the parameters are invalid.
        EzNoSQLException - If the call returned an error, see class for detailed usage and error handling.

            throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                   EzNoSQLException
        Commits one or more transactions in a recoverable database.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the connection instance contains an invalid connection token.
        EzNoSQLException - If the call returned an error, see class for detailed usage and error handling.

      • setAutoCommit

        public void setAutoCommit​(boolean isEnabled)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                          EzNoSQLException
        Indicates whether transactions should be automatically committed in a recoverable database. This setting is ignored in a non-recoverable database. Autocommit is on by default.
        Parameters:
        isEnabled - Indicates whether to enable or disable automatic commit.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the connection instance contains an invalid connection token.
        EzNoSQLException - If the call returned an error, see class for detailed usage and error handling.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                  EzNoSQLException
        Disconnects an established connection to an EzNoSQL database and invalidates its connection token. This method is automatically invoked on objects managed by a try-with-resources statement.
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the connection instance contains an invalid connection token (i.e. already closed)
        EzNoSQLException - If the call returned an error, see class for detailed usage and error handling.

      • insert

        public InsertResult insert​(java.lang.String document)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                           EzNoSQLException
        Inserts a single JSON document into an autogenerated key database. User must ensure the document is a valid JSON format.
        Parameters:
        document - A JSON document.
        Returns:
        Returns a InsertResult containing the result of the insert request.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If parameter is invalid.
        EzNoSQLException - If the request returned an error, see EzNoSQLException for detailed usage and error handling.

      • insert

        public InsertResult insert​(java.lang.String document,
                           java.lang.String key)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                           EzNoSQLException
        Inserts a single JSON document into a primary key database. User must ensure the document is a valid JSON format.
        Parameters:
        document - A valid JSON document.
        key - The primary or alternate key name (e.g. String keyName = "\"my_key\"").
        Returns:
        Returns a InsertResult containing the result of the insert request. An InsertResult instance will contain true if the document was successfully inserted, and a false if a duplicate unique key was detected.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If parameters are invalid.
        EzNoSQLException - If the request returned an error, see EzNoSQLException for detailed usage and error handling.

      • readOne

        public ReadResult readOne​(java.lang.String key,
                          java.lang.String value)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                          EzNoSQLException
        Reads a single JSON document from the database.
        Parameters:
        key - The primary or alternate key name. In the case of auto-generated key databases, user must provide the reserved key keyName = "\"znsq_id\"" when searching by primary index.
        value - The value associated with the primary or alternate key.
        Returns:
        Returns a ReadResult containing the result of the read request. A ReadResult instance will contain true if the document was successfully read, and a false if the key:value pair could not be found.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If parameters are invalid.
        EzNoSQLException - If the request returned an error, see EzNoSQLException for detailed usage and error handling.

      • deleteOne

        public DeleteResult deleteOne​(java.lang.String key,
                              java.lang.String value)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                              EzNoSQLException
        Deletes a single document from a database.
        Parameters:
        key - The primary or alternate key. In the case of auto-generated key databases, user must provide the reserved key keyName = "\"znsq_id\"" when searching by primary index.
        value - The value associated with the primary or alternate key.
        Returns:
        Returns a DeleteResult containing the result of the delete request. A DeleteResult instance will contain true if the document was successfully deleted, and a false if the key-value pair could not be found.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If parameters are invalid.
        EzNoSQLException - If the request returned an error, see EzNoSQLException for detailed usage and error handling.

      • replaceOne

        public ReplaceResult replaceOne​(java.lang.String document,
                                java.lang.String key,
                                java.lang.String value)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                EzNoSQLException
        Queries the database for a document by key:value and issues a replace request. Note that the original document's primary index key cannot be modified.
        Parameters:
        document - The replacement document. Must be a valid JSON String.
        key - The primary or alternate key name. In the case of auto-generated key databases, user must provide the reserved key keyName = "\"znsq_id\"" when searching by primary index.
        value - The value associated with the primary or alternate key.
        Returns:
        Returns a ReplaceResult containing the result of the replace request. A ReplaceResult instance will contain true if the document was successfully found and replaced, and a false if the key-value pair could not be found.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If parameters fail validation.
        EzNoSQLException - If the request returned an error, see EzNoSQLException for detailed usage and error handling.

      • read

        public ResultSet read​(java.lang.String key,
                      java.lang.String value)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                      java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                      EzNoSQLException
        Instantiates a ResultSet positioned to the first exact match in the database.
        Parameters:
        key - The primary or alternate key name. In the case of auto-generated key databases, user must provide the reserved key keyName = "\"znsq_id\"" when searching by primary index.
        value - The value associated with the primary or alternate key. Passing in an empty string will retrieve the top or bottom-level document in the database depending on the ReadAccess flag.
        Returns:
        Returns a ResultSet positioned to the first document that matches the search key and value, or null if no document was found with the provided key value parameters.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If parameters are invalid.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the Connection instance contains an invalid connection token.
        EzNoSQLException - If the request returned an error, see EzNoSQLException for detailed usage and error handling.

      • readGeneric

        public ResultSet readGeneric​(java.lang.String key,
                             java.lang.String value)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                             EzNoSQLException
        Instantiates a ResultSet positioned to the first generic match in the database.
        Parameters:
        key - The primary or alternate key name. In the case of auto-generated key databases, user must provide the reserved key keyName = "\"znsq_id\"" when searching by primary index.
        value - The value associated with the primary or alternate key. Passing in an empty string will retrieve the top or bottom-level document in the database depending on the ReadAccess flag.
        Returns:
        Returns a ResultSet positioned to the first document that matches or is greater than the search key and value, or null if no document was found with the provided key value parameters.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If parameters are invalid
        EzNoSQLException - If the request returned an error, see EzNoSQLException for detailed usage and error handling.

      • readOneForUpdate

        public ReadUpdateResultSet readOneForUpdate​(java.lang.String key,
                                            java.lang.String value)
                                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                            EzNoSQLException
        Obtains an exclusive Read/Update lock and returns a ReadUpdateResultSet for a single document in a database. For a recoverable database, the exclusive lock will be released following commit() or abort(). For a non-recoverable database, the exclusive lock will be released following a ResultSet.replace(java.lang.String), ResultSet.delete(), or a ResultSet.close() if no actions are requested.
        Parameters:
        key - The search key name. In the case of auto-generated databases, user must provide the reserved key = "\"znsq_id\"" in place of a primary key.
        value - The value associated with the search key, or key value for auto-generated keys.
        Returns:
        Returns a ReadUpdateResultSet positioned to the first document that matches the requested key value, or null if no document was found.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If parameters fail validation.
        EzNoSQLException - If an EzNoSQL exception occurred in JNI. See EzNoSQLException for usage and error extraction.
